alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 10:04PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Republic affecting Marquette County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Republic. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.7 feet, Water begins to impact the yards of homes near Bengtson bridge on County Road LI in South Republic * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:41 AM EDT Monday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:41 AM EDT Monday was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 04/24/1985. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday afternoon at 215 PM EDT.
